entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: @custom-media
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: @custom-media
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Prototype%5C%3A+%40custom%5C-media%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: @custom-media</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250724" rel="nofollow">Thu, 24 Jul 2025 04:38:30 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails moon...@google.com </pre><pre>
Explainer None
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-5/#custom-mq">https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-5/#custom-mq</a>
Summary
The proposed @custom-media at-rule is a feature that would allow developers to define and name their own media queries. This would make responsive design code cleaner and more maintainable by reducing repetition. For example: @custom-media --narrow-window (max-width: 30em); @media (--narrow-window) { /* styles for narrow windows */ }
Blink component Blink>CSS
Motivation
The primary motivation for introducing the @custom-media feature is to enhance CSS development by making it more efficient, readable, and maintainable. It directly addresses the common issue of developers having to repeatedly write the same media query conditions, allowing them instead to define meaningful, reusable aliases. This feature is a feature highly requested by developers; the Chromium bug report has 233 stars, Chris Coyier and Stefan Judis have shared interest in this feature in their posts: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.stefanjudis.com/notes/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/">https://www.stefanjudis.com/notes/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/</a>, <a rel="nofollow" href="https://css-tricks.com/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/">https://css-tricks.com/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/</a>.
Initial public proposal None
TAG review None
TAG review status Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
Gecko: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1275">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1275</a>)
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/533">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/533</a>)
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40781325">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40781325</a>) 233 stars on bug report, few posts from web authors: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.stefanjudis.com/notes/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/">https://www.stefanjudis.com/notes/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://css-tricks.com/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/">https://css-tricks.com/can-we-have-custom-media-queries-please/</a>
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? No
Flag name on about://flags None
Finch feature name None
Non-finch justification None
Requires code in //chrome? False
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40781325">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40781325</a>
Estimated milestones
No milestones specified
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5101681238605824?gate=5195524931846144">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5101681238605824?gate=5195524931846144</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68821b30.2b0a0220.24054f.00a6.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/68821b30.2b0a0220.24054f.00a6.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: View Transitions: Inherit more animation properties
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: View Transitions: Inherit more animation properties
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+View+Transitions%5C%3A+Inherit+more+animation+properties%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: View Transitions: Inherit more animation properties</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250730" rel="nofollow">Wed, 30 Jul 2025 01:18:23 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM2
On 7/28/25 4:50 p.m., Vladimir Levin wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><pre></pre><tt>On Wed, Jul 23, 2025 at 11:32 AM Chris Harrelson </tt><tt><chris...@chromium.org> wrote: </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
LGTM1
On Mon, Jul 21, 2025 at 9:53 AM Chromestatus <ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com> wrote:
Contact emails
vmp...@google.com
Explainer
None
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-view-transitions-2">https://www.w3.org/TR/css-view-transitions-2</a>
Summary
Similar to <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5424291457531904">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5424291457531904</a>, which inherited animation-delay, this feature adds more animation properties to inherit through the view transition pseudo tree based on resolution in
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/11546#issuecomment-3005503138:">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/11546#issuecomment-3005503138:</a> * animation-timing-function * animation-iteration-count * animation-direction * animation-play-state
Blink component
Blink>ViewTransitions>SPA
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EViewTransitions%3ESPA%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EViewTransitions%3ESPA%22</a>>
TAG review
None
TAG review status
Not applicable
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
/Gecko/: No signal Due to similarity to <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5424291457531904">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5424291457531904</a> (which shipped in Firefox), and no concerns raised at CSSWG, I suspect this is positive, but no official signals have been filed. Please let me know if you think filing a signal is warranted.
/WebKit/: Shipped/Shipping (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=296174">https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=296174</a>)
/Web developers/: No signals
/Other signals/:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
No
Is this actually "yes"?
Oops. Correct, this should be "yes"
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
Yes
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/css/css-view-transitions/style-inheritance.html">https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/css/css-view-transitions/style-inheritance.html</a>
Flag name on about://flags
Finch feature name
ViewTransitionInheritAnimationProperties
Rollout plan
Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/427741151">https://issues.chromium.org/427741151</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 140 Shipping on Android 140 Shipping on WebView 140
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5154752085884928?gate=6250179786964992">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5154752085884928?gate=6250179786964992</a>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: Crash Reporting key-value API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: Crash Reporting key-value API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Experiment%5C%3A+Crash+Reporting+key%5C-value+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: Crash Reporting key-value API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250730" rel="nofollow">Wed, 30 Jul 2025 12:28:13 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails d...@chromium.org </pre><pre>
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/blob/gh-pages/crashReport-explainer.md">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/blob/gh-pages/crashReport-explainer.md</a>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37</a>
Summary
A new key-value API, tentatively `window.crashReport`, backed by a per-Document map holding data that gets appended to crash reports. See <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/15">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/15</a> for initial discussion. The data placed in this API's backing map gets sent in the `CrashReportBody` [1] if any renderer process crashes are incurred by the site. This lets developers debug what specific state in their application might be causing a given crash. [1]: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/crash-reporting/#crashreportbody">https://wicg.github.io/crash-reporting/#crashreportbody</a>
Blink component Blink>ReportingObserver
TAG review None
TAG review status Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
Gecko: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1271">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1271</a>)
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/528">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/528</a>)
Web developers: Positive First-party partners at Google are excited to be able associate specific app state & data with web-exposed crash reports.
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Goals for experimentation
Ongoing technical constraints
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? No This feature is not fully testable with Web Platform Tests, because WPT infrastructure does not provide the ability to crash specific renderer processes. This limitation has not prevented the Crash Report Infrastructure from shipping in general, nor has it prevented additions like <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4731248572628992">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4731248572628992</a>. This API will be tested with as many web platform tests as possible to assert the shape and semantics of the JS-exposed web API.
Flag name on about://flags CrashReportingStorageAPI
Finch feature name CrashReportingStorageAPI
Requires code in //chrome? False
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/400432195">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/400432195</a>
Estimated milestones
No milestones specified
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6228675846209536?gate=5172180396277760">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6228675846209536?gate=5172180396277760</a>
Links to previous Intent discussions Intent to Prototype: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/687500b2.170a0220.1c6204.01c6.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/687500b2.170a0220.1c6204.01c6.GAE%40google.com</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/688a7245.2b0a0220.35091d.043b.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/688a7245.2b0a0220.35091d.043b.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Re%5C%3A+Intent+to+Experiment%5C%3A+Crash+Reporting+key%5C-value+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Re: Intent to Experiment: Crash Reporting key-value API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Domenic+Denicola%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Domenic Denicola</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250730" rel="nofollow">Wed, 30 Jul 2025 19:44:47 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>
On Thursday, July 31, 2025 at 4:28:22 AM UTC+9 Chromestatus wrote:</pre><pre>
Contact emails d...@chromium.org
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/blob/gh-pages/">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/blob/gh-pages/</a> crashReport-explainer.md
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37</a>
I've noted a few issues, which do not block origin trial but might be worth addressing beforehand since they change the observable impact of the API:
- <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/38">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/38</a> - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/39">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/39</a> - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37/files#r2244219210">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/pull/37/files#r2244219210</a>
Summary
A new key-value API, tentatively `window.crashReport`, backed by a per-Document map holding data that gets appended to crash reports. See <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/15">https://github.com/WICG/crash-reporting/issues/15</a> for initial discussion. The data placed in this API's backing map gets sent in the `CrashReportBody` [1] if any renderer process crashes are incurred by the site. This lets developers debug what specific state in their application might be causing a given crash. [1]: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/crash-">https://wicg.github.io/crash-</a> reporting/#crashreportbody
Blink component Blink>ReportingObserver <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EReportingObserver%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EReportingObserver%22</a>>
TAG review None
TAG review status Pending
It's probably a good idea to file for one at this stage? (But not necessarily required.)
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
*Gecko*: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/</a> 1271)
*WebKit*: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/">https://github.com/WebKit/</a> standards-positions/issues/528)
*Web developers*: Positive First-party partners at Google are excited to be able associate specific app state & data with web-exposed crash reports.
*Other signals*:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Goals for experimentation
Can you paste this in? The generated email is buggy per <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/GoogleChrome/chromium-dashboard/issues/4155">https://github.com/GoogleChrome/chromium-dashboard/issues/4155</a> .
Ongoing technical constraints
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No
Why not?
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ? No
This feature is not fully testable with Web Platform Tests, because WPT infrastructure does not provide the ability to crash specific renderer processes. This limitation has not prevented the Crash Report Infrastructure from shipping in general, nor has it prevented additions like <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4731248572628992">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4731248572628992</a>. This API will be tested with as many web platform tests as possible to assert the shape and semantics of the JS-exposed web API.
Flag name on about://flags CrashReportingStorageAPI
Finch feature name CrashReportingStorageAPI
Requires code in //chrome? False
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/400432195">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/400432195</a>
Estimated milestones
No milestones specified
Can you add estimated milestones?

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] [Intent to Prototype] Layout Instability Attribution in CSS Pixels
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] [Intent to Prototype] Layout Instability Attribution in CSS Pixels
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+%5C%5BIntent+to+Prototype%5C%5D+Layout+Instability+Attribution+in+CSS+Pixels%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] [Intent to Prototype] Layout Instability Attribution in CSS Pixels</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Daniel+Bratell%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Daniel Bratell</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250731" rel="nofollow">Thu, 31 Jul 2025 04:33:02 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<tt>I agree that it seems like a good idea, and the only concern would be </tt><tt>whether it will break things. It sounds like Michal Mocny has been on </tt><tt>top of things, but what were his findings? </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><tt>Once it comes to the shipping decision, the more you can say about </tt><tt>interoperability and compatibility, the better. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><pre></pre><tt>For compatibility between browsers, are there bug issues in the Mozilla </tt><tt>and WebKit databases already? If not, it would be great if you could </tt><tt>file some so that they end up making the same fix. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
/Daniel
On 2025-07-31 08:17, Ane Diaz De Tuesta wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Hello,
</pre><tt>It’s been about 10 days since I shared the Intent to Prototype </tt><tt>proposal, and from what I gather, it has been generally well received. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><tt>As I’m not entirely familiar with the process, I’d like to suggest the </tt><tt>following next steps—unless there are any objections: </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
*
Merge the CL
*
Update the feature status to *“Prepare to ship”* on ChromeStatus
*
Begin drafting the *Intent to Ship* email
</pre><tt>Please let me know if you agree with this approach, or if there’s </tt><tt>anything else I should address before moving forward. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Thanks!
Le mercredi 23 juillet 2025 à 14:03:28 UTC+2, Michal Mocny a écrit :
I do suspect this was more of an oversight than a specific decision, and feedback from developers seems to align with Ane Diaz: most are having to work around this.
However, there are clients out there who now depend on this and we are reaching out to see if it's less of a total headache to fix in place or provide some pathway for compat. Because this is mostly used for logging / tooling and not for real time user experience, so far the feedback has been mostly that this would be fine to break and easy to fix -- but there are a few other consumers we want to get feedback from.
On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 5:45 PM Rick Byers <rby...@chromium.org> wrote:
Sounds like a valuable improvement, thank you!
I see you're talking with @mmocny on the CL <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6624567">https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6624567</a>>, that's great. I wonder if this was just an oversight in our initial design? Seems like a bug to me. Think we can just switch it (and put the change on the changelog
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/speed/metrics_changelog/cls.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/speed/metrics_changelog/cls.md</a>>) without causing compat issues? Or might we need to give devs a way to opt-in to the new semantics? mmocny@ is the expert here though, so I'm happy with whatever he wants to do.
Cheers, Rick
On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 5:00 PM Ane Diaz De Tuesta <ane...@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi all, I'd like to announce an Intent to Prototype for:
* *Feature name:* Layout Instability Attribution in CSS Pixels
* *Contact:* anediaz@gmail
* *Explainer:*
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/anediaz/layout-shift-attribution-in-css-pixels/blob/main/Explainer.md">https://github.com/anediaz/layout-shift-attribution-in-css-pixels/blob/main/Explainer.md</a>
* *Summary:* The Layout Instability API currently reports attribution rectangles (`prevRect` and `currentRect`) in device pixels, which vary based on resolution and `devicePixelRatio`. This change proposes reporting them in CSS pixels for consistency with other layout and performance APIs.
* *Motivation:* This will align attribution with other Web APIs, such as `getBoundingClientRect()` and make layout shift data easier to visualize, debug, and combine across devices and tools.
* *Initial public proposal:* <a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/399058544">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/399058544</a>
* *TAG review:* Not yet requested
* *Risks:* None known. This change only affects how attribution data is reported, and is gated behind a runtime flag.
* *Interoperability:* o Mozilla: No signal o WebKit: No signal
* *Estimated milestones:* N/A (this is a prototype only)
* *Footprint:* This will be implemented behind a runtime flag.
* *Link to entry on Chrome Platform Status: *<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5155103518228480">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5155103518228480</a>
This Intent is to begin prototyping the feature and gather feedback.
Thank you for your help and time. Cheers, Ane Diaz de Tuesta </pre><tt> -- </tt><tt> You received this message because you are subscribed to </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"> the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACBGQem%2BV6_UiLktmqwDCSXC3RJaMpmNm%3DSxv%2BH6%3DY4yCk5Msg%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACBGQem%2BV6_UiLktmqwDCSXC3RJaMpmNm%3DSxv%2BH6%3DY4yCk5Msg%40mail.gmail.com</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACBGQem%2BV6_UiLktmqwDCSXC3RJaMpmNm%3DSxv%2BH6%3DY4yCk5Msg%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CACBGQem%2BV6_UiLktmqwDCSXC3RJaMpmNm%3DSxv%2BH6%3DY4yCk5Msg%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>>.
-- </pre><tt>You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google </tt><tt>Groups "blink-dev" group. </tt><tt>To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send </tt><tt>an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. </tt><tt>To view this discussion visit </tt><tt><a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/15ac55eb-46bc-44d4-b50b-517d21fb27een%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/15ac55eb-46bc-44d4-b50b-517d21fb27een%40chromium.org</a> </tt><tt><<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/15ac55eb-46bc-44d4-b50b-517d21fb27een%40chromium.org?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/15ac55eb-46bc-44d4-b50b-517d21fb27een%40chromium.org?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>>. </tt></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;">
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8ef9a6a2-1223-4920-9d53-ab7353e01992%40gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8ef9a6a2-1223-4920-9d53-ab7353e01992%40gmail.com</a>. </pre>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: FileAPI: Blob.bytes()
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: FileAPI: Blob.bytes()
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Prototype%5C%3A+FileAPI%5C%3A+Blob.bytes%5C%28%5C%29%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: FileAPI: Blob.bytes()</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Suyeon+Ji%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Suyeon Ji</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250801" rel="nofollow">Fri, 01 Aug 2025 02:23:03 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Hi, Thanks for the review. you’re absolutely correct. I misinterpreted some of the background details while reviewing them. My apologies for any confusion this may have caused. Your feedback made me review it again, and I’ve updated the motivation section accordingly.</pre><pre>
*Updated motivation section* Before this change developers could not access an ArrayBuffer directly and had to create a Uint8Array view, and some APIs returned different types which leading to inconsistency. To improve this, design principles have changed[1] in w3c tag side, so the spec was updated[2] accordingly. The new spec removes those hassles, and because WebKit, Firefox and Node.js already support it, bringing it to Chromium will improve interoperability as well.
[1] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-principles/issues/463">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-principles/issues/463</a> [2] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-principles/pull/480">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-principles/pull/480</a> [3] <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/FileAPI/pull/198">https://github.com/w3c/FileAPI/pull/198</a>
chromestatus: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4830298126417920">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4830298126417920</a>
2025년 8월 1일 금요일 오전 7시 3분 30초 UTC+9에 gm...@chromium.org님이 작성:
Just curious, I saw this go by
> Blob.bytes collapses this two-step ritual into a single call, returning a Uint8Array. By removing the extra allocation and copy, it trims garbage-collection overhead and lowers latency when processing large blobs.
There should be no extra allocation as it is
const bytes = new Uint8Array(async someBlob.arrayBuffer())
Does not make 2 allocations (AFAIK). It makes one allocation (the array buffer). And it makes TypeArrayView of that same array buffer
On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 4:02 PM Chromestatus < ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com> wrote:
Contact emails zees...@gmail.com, zi...@chromium.org
Explainer None
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/FileAPI">https://www.w3.org/TR/FileAPI</a>
Design docs <a rel="nofollow" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#dom-blob-bytes">https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#dom-blob-bytes</a>
Summary
The bytes() method of the Blob interface returns a Promise that resolves with a Uint8Array containing the contents of the blob as an array of bytes.
Blink component Blink>Storage>FileAPI <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3EFileAPI%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3EFileAPI%22</a>>
Motivation
Developers currently need to invoke the arrayBuffer method on a Blob and then convert the result into a Uint8Array whenever they want raw bytes. Blob.bytes collapses this two-step ritual into a single call, returning a Uint8Array. By removing the extra allocation and copy, it trims garbage-collection overhead and lowers latency when processing large blobs.
Initial public proposal None
TAG review None
TAG review status Not applicable
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
Safari 18 and Firefox 128 have already shipped the feature.
*Gecko*: Shipped/Shipping ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.firefox.com/en-US/firefox/128.0/releasenotes">https://www.firefox.com/en-US/firefox/128.0/releasenotes</a>)
*WebKit*: Shipped/Shipping ( <a rel="nofollow" href="https://webkit.org/blog/15865/webkit-features-in-safari-18-0">https://webkit.org/blog/15865/webkit-features-in-safari-18-0</a>)
*Web developers*: No signals
*Other signals*:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ? Yes
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/Blob-methods-from-detached-frame.html">https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/Blob-methods-from-detached-frame.html</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/blob/Blob-bytes.any.html">https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/blob/Blob-bytes.any.html</a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/blob/Blob-bytes.any.worker.html">https://wpt.fyi/results/FileAPI/blob/Blob-bytes.any.worker.html</a>
Flag name on about://flags None
Finch feature name None
Non-finch justification None
Requires code in //chrome? False
Estimated milestones
No milestones specified
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4830298126417920?gate=4565118389846016">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4830298126417920?gate=4565118389846016</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com">https://chromestatus.com</a>>.

<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/688952f5.2b0a0220.35091d.0040.GAE%40google.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/688952f5.2b0a0220.35091d.0040.GAE%40google.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>> .

To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/95825de8-7f8c-4a46-b510-f68ecb0caac9n%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/95825de8-7f8c-4a46-b510-f68ecb0caac9n%40chromium.org</a>. </pre>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: IndexedDB getAllRecords() and direction option for getAll()/getAllKeys()
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: IndexedDB getAllRecords() and direction option for getAll()/getAllKeys()
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Re%5C%3A+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+IndexedDB+getAllRecords%5C%28%5C%29+and+direction+option+for+getAll%5C%28%5C%29%5C%2FgetAllKeys%5C%28%5C%29%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: IndexedDB getAllRecords() and direction option for getAll()/getAllKeys()</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250801" rel="nofollow">Fri, 01 Aug 2025 02:23:29 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM2
On 7/31/25 8:43 p.m., Chris Harrelson wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"> Great!</pre><pre>
LGTM1
</pre><tt>On Thu, Jul 31, 2025 at 11:34 AM 'Steve Becker' via blink-dev </tt><tt><blink-dev@chromium.org> wrote: </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
I merged the W3C IndexedDB getAllRecords() spec PR <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/pull/461">https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/pull/461</a>> after reviews from Evan Stade (Microsoft Edge) and Steffen Larssen (Ladybird). Please file an issue in the GitHub <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/issues/new">https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/issues/new</a>>if you have any additional feedback and I'll investigate. A few months ago, I volunteered to be an editor of the W3C IndexedDB spec.
The W3C Tag Review also completed <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1117">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1117</a>> after I sent this intent to ship.
Thank you for reviewing! - Steve
On Wednesday, July 30, 2025 at 12:32:44 PM UTC-7 Evan Stade wrote:
Thanks for the ping. I'm happy with the status of the PR and I think it's ready to merge.
On Wednesday, July 30, 2025 at 8:12:58 AM UTC-7 Alex Russell wrote:
Per today's API OWNERS, there's some question about if and when the spec change might land.
Evan, do you have insight into that process?
Best,
Alex
On Thursday, July 24, 2025 at 8:40:07 PM UTC+1 Chromestatus wrote:
Contact emails
ste...@microsoft.com, rah...@microsoft.com, evan...@microsoft.com
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/MicrosoftEdge/MSEdgeExplainers/blob/main/IndexedDbGetAllEntries/explainer.md">https://github.com/MicrosoftEdge/MSEdgeExplainers/blob/main/IndexedDbGetAllEntries/explainer.md</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/pull/461">https://github.com/w3c/IndexedDB/pull/461</a>
Summary
This feature adds the getAllRecords() API to IndexedDB's IDBObjectStore and IDBIndex. It also adds a direction parameter to getAll() and getAllKeys(). This functionality enables certain read patterns to be significantly faster when compared to the existing alternative of iteration with cursors. One key workload from a Microsoft property showed a 350ms improvement. getAllRecords() effectively combines getAllKeys() and getAll() by enumerating both primary keys and values at the same time. For an IDBIndex, getAllRecords() also provides the record's index key in addition to the primary key and value. getAllRecords() can optionally return records in either ascending or descending order. This option is also back-ported to the existing operations getAll() and getAllKeys().
Blink component
Blink>Storage>IndexedDB
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3EIndexedDB%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EStorage%3EIndexedDB%22</a>>
Search tags
IndexedDB <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:IndexedDB">http:///features#tags:IndexedDB</a>>, getAllRecords <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:getAllRecords">http:///features#tags:getAllRecords</a>>, IDBObjectStore <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:IDBObjectStore">http:///features#tags:IDBObjectStore</a>>, IDBIndex <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:IDBIndex">http:///features#tags:IDBIndex</a>>
TAG review
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1117">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1117</a>
TAG review status
Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
Overloading getAll() and getAllKeys() to accept the IDBGetAllOptions dictionary introduces compatibility risk. Prior to this proposal, when passed a dictionary argument, both getAll() and getAllKeys() throw an exception after failing to convert the dictionary to a key range. After the overload, getAllKeys() and getAll() will no longer throw for dictionary input. When the IDBGetAllOptions dictionary initializes with its default values, it creates a query that retrieves all of the keys or values from the entire database.
/Gecko/: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1261">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1261</a>)
/WebKit/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/521">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/521</a>)
/Web developers/: Positive
(<a rel="nofollow" href="https://nolanlawson.com/2021/08/22/speeding-up-indexeddb-reads-and-writes">https://nolanlawson.com/2021/08/22/speeding-up-indexeddb-reads-and-writes</a>) Developers have reported the limitations addressed by getAllRecords(), including: "You cannot build a paginated cursor in descending order." The following includes another example where getAll() could help but needs to retrieve the index key and primary key:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44349168/speeding-up-indexeddb-search-with-multiple-workers">https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44349168/speeding-up-indexeddb-search-with-multiple-workers</a>
/Other signals/:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
Yes
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/IndexedDB?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=getallrecords">https://wpt.fyi/results/IndexedDB?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=getallrecords</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/IndexedDB?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=getallrecords">https://wpt.fyi/results/IndexedDB?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=getallrecords</a>>
Flag name on about://flags
Finch feature name
IndexedDbGetAllRecords
Rollout plan
Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40746016">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40746016</a>
Sample links
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://patrickbrosset.com/articles/2024-11-19-even-faster-indexeddb-reads-with-getallrecords">https://patrickbrosset.com/articles/2024-11-19-even-faster-indexeddb-reads-with-getallrecords</a>
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://microsoftedge.github.io/Demos/idb-getallrecords">https://microsoftedge.github.io/Demos/idb-getallrecords</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 141 DevTrial on desktop 133 Shipping on Android 141 Shipping on WebView 141
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5124331450138624?gate=5186127942909952">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5124331450138624?gate=5186127942909952</a>
Links to previous Intent discussions
Intent to Prototype:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/zLHOayUfTcw/m/Z13e2qGhBQAJ">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/zLHOayUfTcw/m/Z13e2qGhBQAJ</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com">https://chromestatus.com</a>>.
</pre><tt> -- </tt><tt> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"> Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8e5d76bd-4818-420c-a1eb-1bcd465bd1edn%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/8e5d76bd-4818-420c-a1eb-1bcd465bd1edn%40chromium.org</a>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+FedCM%5C%3A+Alternative+Fields+in+Account+Selection%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250805" rel="nofollow">Tue, 05 Aug 2025 10:27:38 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails cbiesin...@chromium.org </pre><pre>
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194</a>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718</a>
Summary
Adds support for phone numbers and usernames, in addition to or instead of a user's full name and email address as identifiers for disambiguating accounts in the account selector. Also, makes these new fields available for websites to affect the disclosure text.
Blink component Blink>Identity>FedCM
Search tags fedcm
TAG review <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074</a>
TAG review status Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
No compatibility risk as this only adds support for new fields Because Chrome is currently the only implementor of FedCM in general, there is no incremental interop risk for this feature.
Gecko: No signal For incremental improvements to FedCM, Firefox has asked us not to file standards position, and they will instead provide feedback in the GitHub PR. The Firefox lead engineer on FedCM has expressed support in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171</a>
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309</a>) Safari has closed other position requests for FedCM subfeatures without position (eg <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120</a>) in favor of giving a position on FedCM in general. That issue is still open.
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435</a>)
Other signals:
Ergonomics
None
Activation
To fully take advantage of this feature, identity providers may have to check the browser version on the client or server side, or wait until a newer Chrome has rolled out to enough users.
Security
No security risks.
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
n/a, FedCM not supported on WebView
Debuggability
Same as the existing FedCM.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No FedCM in general is not supported on Webview. Supported on all other platforms.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? No <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers">https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers</a> Some of the UI-centric aspects of this feature can not be tested with web platform tests, but the WPT tests we added verify that phone numbers and usernames are supported as valid fields by the user agent.
Flag name on about://flags FedCmAlternativeIdentifiers
Finch feature name FedCmAlternativeIdentifiers
Rollout plan Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome? True
Tracking bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://crbug.com/382086282">https://crbug.com/382086282</a>
Launch bug <a rel="nofollow" href="https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910">https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910</a>
Non-OSS dependencies
Does the feature depend on any code or APIs outside the Chromium open source repository and its open-source dependencies to function? No
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 141
DevTrial on desktop 136
Shipping on Android 141
DevTrial on Android 136
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (eg links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (eg, changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way). We may add support for additional fields in the future but have no concrete plans to do so. This could be things like a user's last name or physical address.

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Customizable select multiple and listbox
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Customizable select multiple and listbox
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Prototype%5C%3A+Customizable+select+multiple+and+listbox%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Customizable select multiple and listbox</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Joey+Arhar%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Joey Arhar</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250806" rel="nofollow">Wed, 06 Aug 2025 12:33:30 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emailsjar...@chromium.org
Explainer<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11477">https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11477</a></pre><pre>
SpecificationNone
Summary
This feature extends customizable select support for other rendering modes of select, including in-page listbox rendering via the size attribute and multi-select via the multiple attribute.
Blink componentBlink>DOM <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EDOM%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EDOM%22</a>>
Motivation
Multiple select is a very common use case on the web which is why we need to support the multiple attribute for customizable select. Supporting in-page rendering also allows authors to build their own picker or dialog to show the listbox, or use the listbox in-page rather than inside a popup.
Initial public proposal<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11477">https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11477</a>
TAG reviewNone
TAG review statusPending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
*Gecko*: No signal
*WebKit*: No signal
*Web developers*: No signals
*Other signals*:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ?No

entry.title: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Speculation rules: desktop "eager" eagerness improvements
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Speculation rules: desktop "eager" eagerness improvements
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Web%5C-Facing+Change+PSA%5C%3A+Speculation+rules%5C%3A+desktop+%5C%22eager%5C%22+eagerness+improvements%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Web-Facing Change PSA: Speculation rules: desktop "eager" eagerness improvements</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250808" rel="nofollow">Fri, 08 Aug 2025 00:51:47 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails t...@chromium.org </pre><pre>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/nav-speculation/speculation-rules.html#:~:text=early%20as%20possible.-,%22moderate%22,balance%20between%20%22eager%22%20and%20%22conservative%22.,-%22conservative%22">https://wicg.github.io/nav-speculation/speculation-rules.html#:~:text=early%20as%20possible.-,%22moderate%22,balance%20between%20%22eager%22%20and%20%22conservative%22.,-%22conservative%22</a>
Summary
On desktop, "eager" eagerness speculation rules prefetches and prerenders now trigger when users hover on a link for a shorter time than the "moderate" mouse hover time. The previous behavior, of starting prefetch/prerenders as soon as possible, was the same as "immediate" eagerness. This new behavior is more useful as it better reflects the author's intent to be more eager than the "moderate" and less eager than "immediate". More detail on this and other upcoming improvements to speculation rules eagerness are available at <a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YPbtUPfZIDElzBZNx8IQMzRFvy8oauLG_i1XIr6jgTs/edit?usp=sharing">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YPbtUPfZIDElzBZNx8IQMzRFvy8oauLG_i1XIr6jgTs/edit?usp=sharing</a>.
Blink component Internals>Preload
TAG review None
TAG review status Not applicable
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
The exact definitions of eagerness levels are left vague in the specification. ("User agents should enact the candidate if user behavior suggests the user may navigate to this URL in the near future. For instance, the user might have scrolled a link into the viewport and moved the cursor over it for some time.") This change is in line with those suggestions. Due to speculation rules' nature as a progressive enhancement, it is very hard to depend on the exact heuristic, so varying across browser engines, platforms, and browser versions should not pose significant interoperability or compatibility risks. As evidence, the heuristic has varied across mobile and desktop ever since launch, and this has not caused such problems.
Gecko: Neutral (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/620#issuecomment-2546739520">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/620#issuecomment-2546739520</a>) We have not asked Firefox for their thoughts on this specific change. They are positive on and implementing prefetching, and will likely make their own choices for how to implement each eagerness level.
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/54">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/54</a>) We've not asked Safari for their thoughts on this specific change. They have recently indicated a tentative positive position towards conservative-eagerness prefetching.
Web developers: Positive We've seen several developers re-create this viewport-based technique using JavaScript to manually insert and remove speculation rules, eg in the Quicklink library.
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No This is only applicable to desktop, and mobile needs other heuristics.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? No Because the specification intentionally allows user agent flexibility, web platform tests do not capture any specific heuristic here.
Flag name on about://flags
Finch feature name PreloadingEagerHeuristics
Rollout plan (RARE) Experiment users ramp up over time
Requires code in //chrome? False
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 141
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (eg links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (eg, changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way). None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113430155591680?gate=6200775483195392">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5113430155591680?gate=6200775483195392</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6895ac8a.050a0220.1fa5e7.0224.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6895ac8a.050a0220.1fa5e7.0224.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+FedCM%5C%3A+Alternative+Fields+in+Account+Selection%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: FedCM: Alternative Fields in Account Selection</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250806" rel="nofollow">Wed, 06 Aug 2025 12:47:08 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM3 (and noting that the TAG review was closed as satisfied).</pre><pre>
On 8/6/25 11:26 a.m., Yoav Weiss (@Shopify) wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM2
On Wednesday, August 6, 2025 at 5:23:50 PM UTC+2 Chris Harrelson wrote:
LGTM1
On Tue, Aug 5, 2025 at 10:27 AM Chromestatus <ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com <<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com">mailto:ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com</a>>> wrote:
Contact emails
cbiesin...@chromium.org
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2718856194</a>>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/pull/718</a>>
Summary
Adds support for phone numbers and usernames, in addition to or instead of a user's full name and email address as identifiers for disambiguating accounts in the account selector. Also, makes these new fields available for websites to affect the disclosure text.
Blink component
Blink>Identity>FedCM
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EIdentity%3EFedCM%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EIdentity%3EFedCM%22</a>>
Search tags
fedcm <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:fedcm">http:///features#tags:fedcm</a>>
TAG review
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1074</a>>
TAG review status
Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
No compatibility risk as this only adds support for new fields Because Chrome is currently the only implementor of FedCM in general, there is no incremental interop risk for this feature.
/Gecko/: No signal For incremental improvements to FedCM, Firefox has asked us not to file standards position, and they will instead provide feedback in the GitHub PR. The Firefox lead engineer on FedCM has expressed support in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435#issuecomment-2776163171</a>>
/WebKit/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/309</a>>) Safari has closed other position requests for FedCM subfeatures without position (e.g. <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/120</a>>) in favor of giving a position on FedCM in general. That issue is still open.
/Web developers/: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435">https://github.com/w3c-fedid/FedCM/issues/435</a>>)
/Other signals/:
Ergonomics
None
Activation
To fully take advantage of this feature, identity providers may have to check the browser version on the client or server side, or wait until a newer Chrome has rolled out to enough users.
Security
No security risks.
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
n/a, FedCM not supported on WebView
Debuggability
Same as the existing FedCM.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
No
FedCM in general is not supported on Webview. Supported on all other platforms.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
No
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers">https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers">https://wpt.fyi/fedcm/alternative-identifiers</a>> Some of the UI-centric aspects of this feature can not be tested with web platform tests, but the WPT tests we added verify that phone numbers and usernames are supported as valid fields by the user agent.
Flag name on about://flags
FedCmAlternativeIdentifiers
Finch feature name
FedCmAlternativeIdentifiers
Rollout plan
Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome?
True
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://crbug.com/382086282">https://crbug.com/382086282</a>
Launch bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910">https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910">https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4390910</a>>
Non-OSS dependencies
Does the feature depend on any code or APIs outside the Chromium open source repository and its open-source dependencies to function?
No
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 141 DevTrial on desktop 136 Shipping on Android 141 DevTrial on Android 136
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
We may add support for additional fields in the future but have no concrete plans to do so. This could be things like a user's last name or physical address.

<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5121180773908480?gate=5086384735649792">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5121180773908480?gate=5086384735649792</a>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: CSS counter() and counters() in alt text of 'content' property
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: CSS counter() and counters() in alt text of 'content' property
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Re%5C%3A+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+CSS+counter%5C%28%5C%29+and+counters%5C%28%5C%29+in+alt+text+of+%27content%27+property%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Re: Intent to Ship: CSS counter() and counters() in alt text of 'content' property</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Daniel+Bratell%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Daniel Bratell</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250702" rel="nofollow">Wed, 02 Jul 2025 08:44:55 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM3 (per Yoav's description)
/Daniel</pre><pre>
On 2025-07-02 17:40, Yoav Weiss (@Shopify) wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"> LGTM2 conditional on two things: 1) Removing the "at risk" label from the spec </pre><tt>2) Including an example in the spec and relevant documentation about </tt><tt>*how* developers are supposed to use this. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><tt>Specifically for (2), since the presence of `counter()` breaks the </tt><tt>"content:" property (as it's invalid syntax in non-supporting </tt><tt>browsers), we want developers that are using this to also provide a </tt><tt>`content:` property that doesn't include a `counter()` and precedes </tt><tt>the one that does. </tt><tt>This needs to be *very* clear to developers that are reaching out for </tt><tt>this tool. </tt><tt>(and right now it isn't. Jeffrey Yasskin on the API owners call </tt><tt>mentioned this is a correct fallback for developers to use) </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
On Wednesday, July 2, 2025 at 5:09:07 PM UTC+2 Chris Harrelson wrote:
LGTM1
On Wed, Jun 25, 2025 at 12:46 AM Daniil Sakhapov <sakha...@chromium.org> wrote:
For Blink there are no performance issues as counter value calculation is performed at the same time as for other counters, so it's not really any different from just using counter().
As the real use case for this feature appeared only with Carousel primitives introduction, I don't know of any signals from web devs, but a11y people support it and it's per OpenUI recommendations for Carousels.
ср, 25 июн. 2025 г. в 04:11, Vladimir Levin <vmp...@chromium.org>:
This feature seems to be marked at-risk due to implementation complexity. It isn't clear whether this would mean that to implement this, some features have to be less performant. Do you expect that this feature adds any performance problems?
I also had a question about the lack of Web Developer signals: are there any that you know of?
Thanks! Vlad
On Monday, June 16, 2025 at 10:44:09 AM UTC-4 Daniil Sakhapov wrote:
Contact emails
sakha...@chromium.org
Explainer
None
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-content/#content-property">https://drafts.csswg.org/css-content/#content-property</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-content/#content-property">https://drafts.csswg.org/css-content/#content-property</a>>
Summary
counter() and counters() in alt text of 'content' property is useful to provide more meaningful information to e.g. pseudo elements to improve their accessibility.
Blink component
Blink>CSS
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3ECSS%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3ECSS%22</a>>
TAG review
None
TAG review status
Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
It's currently "At risk" <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10387">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10387</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10387">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10387</a>>
/Gecko/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1253">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1253</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1253">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1253</a>>)
/WebKit/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/515">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/515</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/515">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/515</a>>)
/Web developers/: No signals
/Other signals/:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
Yes
<a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/css/css-content/parsing/content-counter-valid.html">http://wpt.fyi/css/css-content/parsing/content-counter-valid.html</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/css/css-content/parsing/content-counter-valid.html">http://wpt.fyi/css/css-content/parsing/content-counter-valid.html</a>> <a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content.html">http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content.html</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content.html">http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content.html</a>>
<a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content_alt_counter_invalidation.html">http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content_alt_counter_invalidation.html</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content_alt_counter_invalidation.html">http://wpt.fyi/accname/name/comp_name_from_content_alt_counter_invalidation.html</a>>
Flag name on about://flags
CSSAltCounter
Finch feature name
None
Non-finch justification
None
Rollout plan
Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/417488055">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/417488055</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/417488055">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/417488055</a>>
Estimated milestones
DevTrial on desktop 138 DevTrial on Android 138
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
